Name: indexrelid
Description: the oid of the pg_class entry for this index

Name: indrelid
Description: the oid of the pg_class entry for the table this index is for

Name: indnatts
Description: the number of columns in the index (duplicates pg_class.relnatts)

Name: indisunique
Description: if true, this is a unique index

Name: indisprimary
Description: if true, this index represents the primary key of the table (indisunique should always be true when this is true)

Name: indisexclusion
Description: if true, this index supports an exclusion constraint

Name: indimmediate
Description: if true, the uniqueness check is enforced immediately on insertion (irrelevant if indisunique is not true)

Name: indisclustered
Description: if true, the table was last clustered on this index

Name: indisvalid
Description: if true, the index is currently valid for queries. false means the index is possibly incomplete: it must still be modified by insert/update operations, but it cannot safely be used for queries. if it is unique, the uniqueness property is not true either.

Name: indcheckxmin
Description: if true, queries must not use the index until the xmin of this pg_index row is below their transactionxmin event horizon, because the table may contain broken hot chains with incompatible rows that they can see

Name: indisready
Description: if true, the index is currently ready for inserts. false means the index must be ignored by insert/update operations.

Name: indkey
Description: this is an array of indnatts values that indicate which table columns this index indexes. for example a value of 1 3 would mean that the first and the third table columns make up the index key. a zero in this array indicates that the corresponding index attribute is an expression over the table columns, rather than a simple column reference.

Name: indcollation
Description: for each column in the index key, this contains the oid of the collation to use for the index.

Name: indclass
Description: for each column in the index key, this contains the oid of the operator class to use. see pg_opclass for details.

Name: indoption
Description: this is an array of indnatts values that store per-column flag bits. the meaning of the bits is defined by the index's access method.

Name: indexprs
Description: expression trees (in nodetostring() representation) for index attributes that are not simple column references. this is a list with one element for each zero entry in indkey. null if all index attributes are simple references.

Name: indpred
Description: expression tree (in nodetostring() representation) for partial index predicate. null if not a partial index.
